simj

Class SimRandom

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.Random
      • simj.SimRandom
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable

    public final class SimRandom
extends Random
    This singleton class has features for producing random numbers. There is one feature for each defined statistical law.
    Author:
    Patrik Fuhrer
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      double expo(double mu)
      Returns a double random number following an exponential law of mean mu.
      static SimRandom getUniqueInstance()
      Returns the unique instance of this Singleton class.
      double uniform(double minValue, double maxValue)
      Returns a double random number following a uniform law between minValue and maxValue.

      • Methods inherited from class java.util.Random

        next, nextBoolean, nextBytes, nextDouble, nextFloat, nextGaussian, nextInt, nextInt, nextLong, setSeed

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Method Detail

      • expo

        public double expo(double mu)
        Returns a double random number following an exponential law of mean mu.
        Parameters:
        mu - The mean of the exponential random variable.
        Returns:
        A random number following an exponential law of mean mu

      • getUniqueInstance

        public static SimRandom getUniqueInstance()
        Returns the unique instance of this Singleton class.
        Returns:
        The unique instance of this class.

      • uniform

        public double uniform(double minValue,
             double maxValue)
        Returns a double random number following a uniform law between minValue and maxValue.
        Parameters:
        minValue - The minimal possible value of the uniform random variable.
        maxValue - The maximal possible value of the uniform random variable.
        Returns:
        A double random number following a uniform law between minValue and maxValue.
